rules: Rule1: If the production uses animal footage of a lion, then it completes an episode.
Rule2: Provided that the production uses animal footage of an elephant, it completes an episode.
Rule3: Whenever the production has camera equipment as material, it uses animal footage of a lion or it uses animal footage of an elephant.
Rule4: The production has camera equipment as material or it has editing software as material.

Rule5: Either the production exceeds its budget, or if it is not the case that having editing software as material implies the use of animal footage of a lion or an elephant, then the production delays its release.
Rule6: The production gets an award or it does not exceed its budget.
Rule7: Should it not be true that having editing software as material leads to using animal footage of a lion or an elephant, then the production needs a reshoot.
Rule8: If the absence of the implication that having editing software as material entails using animal footage of a lion or an elephant holds, then the production does not need a reshoot.
Rule9: Given that it is not the case that the production having editing software as material necessitates using animal footage of a lion or an elephant, the production does not delay its release.
facts: Fact1: The production does not get an award.
